elevationruler.name: Elevation Ruler
elevationruler.keybindings.decrementElev: Decrease the elevation in grid increments when using the ruler.
elevationruler.keybindings.incrementElev: Increase the elevation in grid increments when using the ruler.
elevationruler.keybindings.addWaypointTo: When token ruler is enabled, add a waypoint while dragging the token.
elevationruler.keybindings.removeWaypoin: When token ruler is enabled, remove a waypoint while dragging the token.
elevationruler.settings.levels-use-floor: If Levels module is active, label the ruler with the current floor, if the Levels UI floors are named.
elevationruler.settings.levels-labels-ui: Only when Levels UI is active
elevationruler.settings.prefer-token-ele: Add a control to the token toolbar to prefer the token elevation when measuring. When toggled on, the control will keep the ruler at the elevation of the measuring token unless another token is encountered or the grid space is at a higher elevation than the token. Otherwise, the ruler will assume the elevation of the grid space or the token encountered.
elevationruler.settings.enable-token-rul: Display the ruler when dragging tokens.
elevationruler.settings.token-ruler-high: When using the ruler, use different colors for token walk/dash/max distance.
elevationruler.settings.token-speed-prop: For token speed highlighting, this is the actor property representing token walking speed.
elevationruler.settings.token-fly-proper: For token speed highlighting, this is the actor property representing token flying speed.
elevationruler.settings.token-burrow-pro: For token speed highlighting, this is the actor property representing token burrowing speed.
elevationruler.settings.token-speed-mult: For token speed highlighting, this is the multiplier used to go from walk to run (dash) to maximum. For example, with a multiplier of 2, a token with 25 walk speed will have its ruler highlight orange after the first 25 units of distance, and red after the first 50.
elevationruler.settings.round-to-multipl: For gridless distance measurement, round the distance displayed to the nearest multiple of the number entered. Leave blank to disable rounding.
elevationruler.settings.token-terrain-mu: Multiplier to use to calculate movement speed when moving through other tokens. Set to 1 to ignore. Values less than 1 treat token spaces as faster than normal; values greater than 1 penalize movement through token spaces.
elevationruler.settings.pathfinding_toke: For pathfinding, do tokens block the path?
elevationruler.settings.pathfinding_limi: When pathfinding, limit the range of the pathfinding to explored areas unless the user is the GM
elevationruler.settings.grid-terrain-alg: When on a grid, how to account for movement penalties or bonuses from terrain and tokens? Center: apply if the terrain/token overlaps the grid center; Percent Area: apply if the terrain/token covers at least this much of the grid square/hex; Euclidean: prorate based on percent of line segment within the terrain/token between this grid square/hex and the previous.
elevationruler.settings.grid-terrain-are: If 'Percent Area' is selected for Terrain Grid Measurement, this determines the percent overlap required for the terrain/token to count when measuring on grids.
elevationruler.drawingconfig.movementPen: Set to 1 for no penalty. Values greater than one penalize movement by that percent; values less than one effectively grant a bonus to movement. For example, set to 2 to double movement through this area.
